exceptionUUID.description: a unique generated error code from the service

startDateTime.description: Date and time of the sale start (UTC). Returns the value if the sale status equals PLANNED or ACTIVE. Otherwise returns null

progressPercentage.description: Percentage of sale progress. Returns the value if the sale status equals ACTIVE. Otherwise returns null

logicalOperator.description: A logical operator that connects the current group to the preceding condition groups. This value may be null when this is the first group within the structure.

rulesInGroup.description: An array of conditions that form a single group. These conditions are linked together using logical operators.

ConditionRuleGroupV1DTO.description: A system of conditions for project completion, organized into groups that are combined using logical operators (AND or OR). Conditions within each group can also be linked by these operators. Each condition evaluates a parameter (like XP or project status) using comparison operators (IN, =, >, <).

logicalOperator.description: A logical operator that links the current condition to the preceding conditions within the group. This value may be null if this is the first condition in the group.

fieldId.description: A unique identifier for the parameter being checked.

fieldName.description: The name of the parameter being checked. Examples: "Projects in status", "XP", "Skill", "Level", "Days on the course", "Project Cluster in status", "Retry is not available if project accepted/failed"

subFieldKey.description: The identifier for the subcategory of the parameter being checked (if applicable). Example of subcategory: clarification, such as which specific project status or skill is being checked.

subFieldValue.description: The value of the subcategory for the parameter being checked (if applicable), such as the project status or skill name. Status values ("REGISTERED/IN PROGRESS", "REVIEWING", "ACCEPTED", "NOT REGISTERED") can apply to parameters like "Project in status" or "Project Cluster in status"; skill names apply to the skill parameter; null if the parameter does not have a subcategory.

operator.description: The operator used to compare values or check if the value belongs to a specific set. Examples: "IN", ">", "<", "="

value.description: An array of value objects to compare against. For such parameters as "Projects in status" and "Project Cluster in status," it may contain multiple project/course objects.

ConditionRuleValueV1DTO.description: A condition object that contains information about the parameter to be evaluated and the value being checked.

key.description: The identifier or numeric value to be compared with the participant's value (e.g., project ID or skill points).

value.description: Parameter value. The name for projects or courses; null for numeric validation (e.g., XP or skill).

description.example: Learn to use a regex library

expToNextLevel.description: Number of experience points to the next level

completionDateTime.description: Date and time of the last completion (UTC)

teamMembers.description: Team members of the last attempt

courseId.description: ID of the course where the project is located

peerReviewPoints.description: Participantâ€™s number of Peer Review Points

codeReviewPoints.description: Participantâ€™s number of Code Review Points

averageVerifierPunctuality.description: Average punctuality score for a peer review

averageVerifierInterest.description: Average interest score for a peer review

averageVerifierThoroughness.description: Average thoroughness score for a peer review

averageVerifierFriendliness.description: Average friendliness score for a peer review

accrualDateTime.description: Date and time of XP accrual (UTC)

completionDateTime.description: Date and time of the last completion (UTC)

receiptDateTime.description: Date and time of the receipt (UTC)

code.description: Node item code in the graph

entityId.description: ID of the entity linked to the node item

description.example: We'll learn how to make a bowl out of clay

startDateTime.description: Date and time of the start of the event (UTC)

endDateTime.description: Date and time of the end of the event (UTC)

organizers.description: Array of strings with the logins of the organizing participants

capacity.description: Maximum number of participants who can register for the event

registerCount.description: Current number of participants registered for the event

description.example: A group of projects to master SQL syntax.

login.description: Login of the participant occupying the place

fullName.example: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry

floor.description: The floor where the cluster is located
